speaker: Matthew Barr
text: Sounding like a continuation of dark humour from "Dial M For Martin," this episode was something of a disappointment. DHP was great, although his faked enthusiasm for his new place was a little too realistic. Highlights included the car chase and touring the apartment. The plot wasn't exceptional, and there weren't any memorable lines, but some displays of "brotherly love" (the Noel Coward pen) and plot transgression make this a lot better than the last two shows. **C-**

speaker: Nicholas Hartley
text: This episode started off pretty boring. I found Niles particularly disturbing. I know he's always a strange little man, but I just couldn't take the facial cream and the babbling lake. However, I must praise part two, it was glorious. The whole "Shangri-La" apartment scene were wonderful. It showed Niles in his usual state of denial. There were some great gags like "Jimmy put on pants to come up here." I couldn't stop laughing when Niles walked to the door in the Hawaiian shirt and sat on the lazy-boy just like Martin. It was great how he changes his role model from his mother to his father. **B+**   * * *  ## Transcript {nicholas hartley}    _Act One. Scene One - Frasier's BMW Frasier and Martin are driving around Seattle.  They are heading towards the Montana to pick Niles up for a night out._

speaker: Martin
text: You know where we should go tonight?  Frannie's Fish & Chips!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, we're taking Niles out to boost his spirits, not his cholesterol!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh please, that French food that you guys eat is full of butter and cheese.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but at least it's not made by a woman working a deep fryer in a batter-dipped brassiere.  _They stop at a light.  A red hatchback pulls up alongside them. Niles is the driver.  Martin notices him._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, isn't that Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Where?

speaker: Martin
text: Driving that old hatchback.

speaker: Frasier
text: Nah, Niles would never be seen in anything called a hatchback. But it does look a lot like him.  _Frasier honks his horn.  Niles looks, sees them - and drives off at full speed._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, he's running away!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, catch him, Mr. 12-cylinder German engineering! _Frasier and Martin chase Niles across Seattle.  On his car phone, Frasier dials in Niles's cell phone number.  Ahead of them, Niles answers:_

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what the hell are you doing?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm just pulling into my parking garage.  You on your way?

speaker: Frasier
text: What are you talking about?!  You're driving up 2nd Avenue!

speaker: Martin
text: You're in that little red thing.

speaker: Niles
text: No I'm not, you must be mistaking me for someone else.  See you when you get here. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: He's getting away.  He just took a right at the corner.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!  What are you running away from us for?  I can see that it's you!

speaker: Niles
text: No, you're mistaking me for someone else.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is ridiculous, I can hear my own horn through the phone!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, I may lose the connection, I'm just stepping onto my elevator.  I'll see you when you- [_hangs up_]

speaker: Martin
text: What's the matter with him?

speaker: Frasier
text: Maris repossessed his car, that must have been all he can afford.  He's just ashamed to admit it. [_dials Niles again_]

speaker: Niles
text: Hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, do not hang up on me!  We know what's going on!  We're right behind you.

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, I was afraid this would happen - I was petrified someone I knew would see me driving this humiliating car! It looks like some buggy derailed from a carnival ride, except this has no safety features.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, you're worrying over nothing. What kind of person judges you by the sort of car you drive?

speaker: Niles
text: Mitsy Gill.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, she might, she drives a Bentley.

speaker: Niles
text: She's parking on the corner - she'll see me!  _Niles brakes to a sudden stop, and his head goes under the dashboard in a motion that is half jerk, half duck.  Behind him, Frasier also must brake suddenly to stop a crash, jerking himself and Martin in their seats._

speaker: Martin
text: Is everyone alright?

speaker: Niles
text: [_still on the mobile, from under the dashboard_] Dad, come quickly, I need your help.

speaker: Martin
text: [_alarmed_] Oh my God!  What is it?

speaker: Niles
text: I need you to get up here and pretend this is your car.  _Martin gives a look of disgust at Frasier.  FADE OUT  Scene Two - The Montana The gang arrive in Niles's apartment.  Niles rubs his shoulder as he sits down._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my shoulder is killing me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, did you bang into the steering wheel?

speaker: Niles
text: No, I've been parallel parking all week without power steering.

speaker: Martin
text: Let me get you some aspirin.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, thank you, Dad.  Er, check upstairs in the bathroom of the study.  Pardon the disarray, Frasier, I've had to cut the cleaning lady down to two times a week.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastic_] Yeah, looks like a bomb went off.

speaker: Frasier
text: I gather your financial situation's gotten a bit shaky.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, every since I rejected Maris's attempts to woo me back, she's been quite vindictive!  She's frozen all the accounts!  Sherry? [_pours two glasses of sherry_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: My salary isn't even covering my legal bills.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you lawyers tell you?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, mostly that my salary isn't even covering my legal bills!

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if this siege is going to continue you might have to tighten your belt a bit.  Perhaps we should make up a list of your expenses. [_takes some paper and a pen from the box_]

speaker: Niles
text: Alright. [_notices pen_] But not with that pen.  That once belonged to Noel Coward.  I just purchased it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it is stunning, Niles, but you know if you're going to be economizing perhaps you'll have to forego the decorative antique pens.

speaker: Niles
text: Could we at least review my list before making any drastic decisions?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well.

speaker: Niles
text: [_writes down notes_] That's my rent... that's insurance...

speaker: Frasier
text: You pay that much in rent?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, that includes the building newsletter.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's outrageous!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, are you there?

speaker: Niles
text: [_into intercom_] Yes, Dad. [_to Frasier_] You can't blame me for the housing market - this is a simple apartment!

speaker: Martin
text: I'm in some room with a lot of books but it doesn't have a bathroom!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, that's the library, not the study - go down the hall, make a left.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, this simple apartment of yours is going to bankrupt you!  You must admit it's a bit large for one person.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, don't forget I have a pet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you saying that your BIRD requires both a study and a library?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, I will return the Noel Coward pen, but this is my home.  This is a basic necessity.

speaker: Martin
text: [_on intercome_] OK, I've found the aspirin but I'm lost again. I'm in a blue room with big rolls of paper.

speaker: Niles
text: That's the gift wrapping room.  Look for the stairs.

speaker: Martin
text: The only stairs I can find go up!

speaker: Frasier
text: You have a THIRD floor?

speaker: Niles
text: It's practically a crawl space. [_into intercom_] Go out the door to the left.

speaker: Niles
text: Don't look at me like that!  I have to have a roof over my head!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you have three roofs over your head!  For God's sake, you have to come to your senses.  Look at the numbers, they don't lie!  I'm afraid you don't have any choice. _Martin comes out onto the balcony over the main room.  He shouts over to Niles._

speaker: Martin
text: Alright, now I'm stuck.  How do I get down, there's a bookcase blocking my way.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the bookcase is a secret door, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: How do I open it?

speaker: Niles
text: Just poke "Mrs. Dalloway" on the bottom.

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Niles
text: The yellow book on the lower shelf.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, right! [_exits_]

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, every since I was a little boy I have walked by this building and wondered what sort of people could live in such a magnificent place.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Getting in here after Maris dumped me proved that I was not a complete failure.

speaker: Frasier
text: I understand that.

speaker: Niles
text: And I have no choice, do I?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sorry.  You know Niles, perhaps you should move before you're obligated for another month's rent here.  You can stay at my place until you find something.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Martin
text: [_enters with aspirin_] Here you go, you can get your own glass of water.

speaker: Niles
text: This aspirin's expired.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, it wasn't when I found it.  _He sinks into an armchair, exhausted.  FADE TO:_  **NUCLEAR FAMILY** _Scene Three - Apartment Later, Niles has moved into Frasier's apartment.  Niles and Daphne are working along side each other in the kitchen._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh Dr. Crane, I'll clean up.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, not necessary.

speaker: Daphne
text: You've been cooking dinner every night, [_laughs_] I hardly feel like it's my kitchen anymore.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course it's your kitchen... [_Daphne puts something in the fridge_] No, that doesn't go there!  I know it's probably a bit presumptuous of me to rearrange your kitchen for you but I promise you, you'll find it a lot more... _Niles trails off as he watches Daphne bend over to reach for something on the bottom shelf._

speaker: Niles
text: User-friendly...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_straightens up_] Where's my jar of Bovril?

speaker: Niles
text: [_snapping back_] No, I wasn't! [_realizing_] Oh, the meat paste! Well, I threw it out, it smelled rancid.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, that's how it's supposed to smell - it's English!  _Meanwhile, Frasier and Martin are reading in the main room.  Frasier opens conversation._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm off to bed! [_Martin doesn't reply_] Roz and I have a very important breakfast meeting with an important employer tomorrow.  I can't burn the midnight oil like you, Dad. [_Martin doesn't reply_] Dad!  _Martin had fallen asleep whilst reading, he wakes up not knowing what's going on._

speaker: Martin
text: What?  Oh all right, I'll get a coaster!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, what is it with you?  You could barely stay awake during dinner!

speaker: Martin
text: [_rubs his eyes_] Oh, you'd feel the same way if you shared a room with Niles.  All night long, up and down, shifting and tucking.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if it's really annoying you that much, I'll just move his cot into my room.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: At least one member of this family can show some compassion.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, good luck!  Last night I got up and went to the bathroom -- when I came back he'd made my bed!  _End of Act One. (Time: 7:15)  Act Two.  Scene Four In Frasier's bedroom, Frasier is in bed listening to Niles in the en suite bathroom.  Niles is gargling and spitting._

speaker: Frasier
text: Will you be much longer?

speaker: Niles
text: Almost done.

speaker: Frasier
text: I only ask because Roz and I have this very important job interview tomorrow, I'd like to be well rested.  You've been in there for twenty minutes!

speaker: Niles
text: No I haven't. [_a bell is heard_] Now I have!  You should try this marvelous new facial feel, it's like getting ten years back!

speaker: Frasier
text: What about the last half hour?

speaker: Niles
text: It's going to be so much fun bunking together like when we were kids.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, it's all coming back to me now.

speaker: Niles
text: I just want to tell you again how much I appreciate your taking me in like this.  Not every brother in your position would be so generous. [_gets into his only little bed_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Think nothing of it Niles, it's no trouble at all.  [_There is rest until Niles decides to switch on some air refiners. He has around half a dozen which make an awful noise.  Frasier turns the lights out.  However, Niles isn't comfy until he's closed the window from the rain noise - Frasier remarks "I'm amazed you can hear it over in Mission Control!"  Niles goes back to bed and puts on a strange radio.  It begins playing rain falling - similar to what he just the shut the window for._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, what are you talking about?  That's just more rain noise!

speaker: Niles
text: No, it's much more than rain.  This is all the sounds of the Brazilian rain forest.  Does it bother you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No.  Go to bed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake!

speaker: Niles
text: Alright, alright, I'll switch over to babbling brook.

speaker: Niles
text: If you're feeling tense about that interview I can show you one of my breathing exercises.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no!  Just some sleep will do.  _They both go to sleep but Niles begins doing his breathing exercises which wake Frasier.  He pushes his arms out as he breathes out and vice versa.  He does this twice.  On the third time he just breathes

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, for God's sake, Niles!  He puts the lights on.  However the lights along with Niles's "equipment" fuse the circuits - now it is pitch black._

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell happened?

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't it obvious?  You blew a fuse.

speaker: Frasier
text: You haven't seen anything yet!

speaker: Niles
text: Ow! **THE LATE SHOW** _Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa The following morning, Roz is waiting with the employer, Mr. Draper, by herself.  Frasier is obviously late._

speaker: Roz
text: Listen, I know he's on his way, he must have got the address wrong.  I knew I should have picked a place he's been to before.

speaker: Draper
text: I'm sorry, I'm afraid I have to...

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, please don't leave.  Let me just try his cell phone.

speaker: Draper
text: Very well. [_hands Roz his phone_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_into phone_] Hello Frasier, it's Roz.  You sound terrible, where are you?  The emergency room?!  Oh my God!  His appendices burst!  No, no, don't apologize.  It's not your fault.  We'll just reschedule it... _At this point Frasier bursts into the room whilst Roz is still on the phone with "him."_

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry I'm late!

speaker: Draper
text: [_to Roz_] My phone please! [_she hands it to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Mr. Draper, you're not leaving, are you?

speaker: Draper
text: I have another meeting and I don't like to keep people waiting! [_leaves_]

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Frasier_] I'm going to kill you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, please, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: Where the hell have you been?

speaker: Frasier
text: Blame Niles, he kept me up so late last night I slept right through my alarm.

speaker: Roz
text: What's he still doing there, hasn't he found a place yet?!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, he's sublet his apartment at the Montana.  He has to find something furnished.  There just aren't many out there. Still, he's looking every day!

speaker: Roz
text: Not yesterday.

speaker: Frasier
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Roz
text: I saw him outside the cinema waiting in line for "Lawrence Of Arabia."

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's impossible, he told me he had appointments all day!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I know Niles when I see him.  How people go to the movies with their own seat cushion?

speaker: Frasier
text: You mean he hasn't even been looking?!

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, ask him yourself.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Off for another day apartment hunting?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.  I hope I see as many as I saw yesterday, covered the whole waterfront.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, then you must have seen the one on Crawford and Pike?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: White with blue trim?  Right next to the market, couple of flags upfront.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!  It looks nice from the outside but it's completely unsuitable for living in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, I imagine so, seeing as it's a [_angry_] Chevron station!  You saw nothing!  Nothing yesterday, probably nothing in the last two weeks.  You've been going to the movies.

speaker: Niles
text: That is an outrageous lie!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz saw you _and_ your seat cushion.  I was feeling sorry for you while you were lying to me the whole time.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry, after the first day I just couldn't look anymore. I'll never find anything tolerable in my price range.  It's barely tolerable having a price range. [_checks for nose bleed_]

speaker: Frasier
text: All right Niles, well today I'm going with you.  It may be the only way you'll find a place.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you make it sound as if I plan to stay with you forever!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I did notice you put a bottle of '93 Pechie Beron on the grocery list last night.

speaker: Niles
text: So?

speaker: Frasier
text: That wine's not even drinkable for two years! _FADE TO:  Scene Six - The Shangri-La Later, Niles and Frasier are touring a rather run-down block of apartments - the Shangri-La.  They are in the corridor outside a room.  The manager, Frank, is showing them around._

speaker: Frank
text: An' we got a rec room too!  And did you see the hot tub?

speaker: Niles
text: If you referring to that six-man petri dish, yes.  I think we're about finished here!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, we can't leave without seeing the apartment.  Frank was kind enough to put on pants to bring us up here.

speaker: Frank
text: [_opens door_] Welcome to the "Shangri-La!"  _Niles and Frasier look in with faces of horror.  What they are looking at would barely pass as a motel room in a fishing village._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_obviously put on_] Oh Niles, it's... magnificent!  _FADE TO:  Scene Seven A few moments have passed, and Frank is showing Niles around his new "apartment."_

speaker: Frank
text: I think you'll see why the Shangri-La is so popular with bachelors like yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: I'd assume it was that charming "NO CREDIT NO PROBLEM" banner out front.

speaker: Frank
text: Here's your kitchen. [_part of living room_] All modern.  Looks like the previous tenant left a four-slot toaster behind.

speaker: Frasier
text: Isn't that something, Niles?  You can make yourself a club sandwich and still have a slice left over for guests!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh well, I think I've got the lay of the land.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wait, we haven't seen the bedroom yet.

speaker: Frank
text: Oh, right this way!  _Frank unlocks a door and pulls it down.  The bed folds down into the living room.  The bed has sheets but is tatty._

speaker: Frank
text: Looks like he left the sheets behind too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, how's that for convenience?  No dust bunnies under that bed, no sir-ee!  That is a vacuumer's dream, that is. Well, let's have a look at this closet space, shall we?

speaker: Frank
text: Oh sorry, I thought Gary's sister was supposed to pick this stuff up.  Well, help yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: This Gary certainly seems to have left in a hurry.  Did he leave no forwarding address?

speaker: Frank
text: [_uncomfortable_] Uh, he left a note, but... nooo.  No address! Well, take your time.

speaker: Niles
text: NOW can we go?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles, not before we have a look at this... [_opens cupboard to a fold-down ironing board_] this very charming little ironing board here.

speaker: Niles
text: You're sure that's not the guest room?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, listen, I know this isn't what you had in mind but we have scoured the city, I'm afraid this is the only thing we're gonna find.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I want to keep looking, there's no rush.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, actually...

speaker: Niles
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh!  You want me to move out.  I've overstayed my welcome, I see.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it's time to understand that your circumstances have changed.  You are going to have to adapt.

speaker: Niles
text: I don't want to adapt.  I want to go home!

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles... you are home!

speaker: Niles
text: Well... where are my manners?  Can I get you some toast? _FADE TO:  Scene Eight - Apartment Later, Frasier is doing some wine tasting.  He has a blindfold on and takes a drink before spitting it out.  Then he takes his blindfold off and takes a cover off of the wine to reveal what it is.  He makes a yes to the correct answer as Daphne enters from the hallway with her purse._

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, I'm off.  Oh, your brother called - he said he won't be joining you for your wine club tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  That's a first.

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, it's funny how much Eddie misses that bird of Dr. Crane's.  This morning a pigeon landed on the terrace, Eddie jumped up excited, ran over and started barking at it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes he does that all the time.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, no, this was a different sort of bark, like: [_excited_] "You're not my bird!  Don't fly over here and get my hopes up like that!  You're not my bird!"  It was silly and sad at the same time, you know?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_deadpan_] Firsthand.  Niles say why he cancelled at all?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I just hope he's not depressed.  I keep picturing him sitting in that dreadful apartment all alone.  I guess I should have let him stay here a little longer until he found something nicer.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sure as soon as he's got his books on the shelf and his opera playing he'll be fine.  You have nothing to feel guilty about.

speaker: Martin
text: [_entering_] Oh Fras, your antiques scout brought over that Noel Coward pen you bought. [_Frasier buries his head_]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Frasier_] Noel Coward pen?  Like the one your brother's got?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it is his!  He returned it and I pounced on it!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Martin_] Dr. Crane's feeling bad about moving his brother out.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh come on, Fras.  He's a big boy, you just gave him the push he needed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he did need a push.

speaker: Daphne
text: Besides, I'm sure the place you've found him isn't as bad as all that.

speaker: Frasier
text: You're right, Daphne, it isn't all that bad.  Yeah, once he's decorated it, it'll be much nicer.  You're right, you're right.  I'm being much too hard on myself.  I'm sure he'll be perfectly happy in the Shangri-La.

speaker: Martin
text: You got him in the Shangri-La?  That's where Duke stayed during his divorce.  Oh, let me tell ya', that's my kinda place. [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What have I done?! _Scene Nine - The Shangri-La That evening, a doorbell sounds in Niles's new apartment.  Niles emerges from a room dressed in an Hawaiian shirt, but still wearing his gold watch.  He answers the door - it's Frasier and Martin._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_cheerful surprise_] Dad!  Frasier!  Did you not get my message about the wine club?

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, but we thought it'd be just fun to have a nice dinner.

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, I'm just on my way out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where to?  Bali H'ai?

speaker: Niles
text: No, they're having a ping pong tournament in the rumpus room and my neighbor, Jimbo, has invited me to be his partner, so let me just go and tell him I'll be a couple of minutes late. If you're thirsty they sent up some wine coolers in my welcome basket. [_exits_]

speaker: Martin
text: And you were worried.  He's making friends, taking part in activities...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, he's obviously covering!  That shirt alone is a shriek for help!

speaker: Martin
text: Is it so hard for you to believe that he can actually be happy?

speaker: Frasier
text: In this place?  Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: [_enters_] Oh, you should stay, the guys in D building are bringing over a six-foot sub and they've rigged the pinball machine so it's free play all night. [_makes a strange dance_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you know I'm finding it a bit difficult to accept this newfound enthusiasm of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, weren't you the one who told me that I should adjust to my new circumstances?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, but I'm just concerned that you're immersing yourself in this lifestyle just to avoiding feeling the pain you're going...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, would you just leave the guy alone!  He's obviously having a good time!  _Martin and Frasier begin arguing as Niles sits in his "lazy boy" chair, putting his feet up on a footrest.  He sits back looking just like Martin in his "throne."_

speaker: Martin
text: I'd be happy here myself - this is my kind of place.

speaker: Niles
text: [_howl of despair_] Get me out of this hell hole!

speaker: Martin
text: What did I say?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I can't live this charade!  I have tried, it's taking too much out of me.

speaker: Martin
text: Now Niles, this place is fine, and you know what they say: "What doesn't kill you makes you stronger."

speaker: Niles
text: But Dad, not everyone makes it into that second group.  And I've got the luau shirt to prove it. [_gets up_] Alright, that's it, enough is enough. [_takes his phone and dials_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, who are you calling?

speaker: Niles
text: I am calling Maris, I'm going to beg her to take me back.

speaker: Frasier
text: You don't want to do that!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, I do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_rapidly_] Life with Maris wasn't so bad.  It was my fault, after all!  I was too rigid, I was always making demands!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: "Eat something!  Unlock this door!  Don't throw that!"

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, give me that phone.

speaker: Niles
text: No!

speaker: Martin
text: You don't know what you're doing!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes I do.

speaker: Martin
text: Just drop it and kick it over here!

speaker: Niles
text: I won't!  I'm dialing, I'm pressing Send, it's ringing. [_into phone_] Maris!  I'm calling... I'm calling...

speaker: Niles
text: I'm calling to tell you that there's a new address for forwarding my mail.  62 Elm Street, Shangri-La Apartments. Thank you [_hangs up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, good for you, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, the second I heard her voice I knew I couldn't go back. [_looks at the room_] But how am I ever going to live here?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it's just temporary, Niles.  She can't drag this divorce out forever.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, perhaps this place is the price you'll have to pay for your freedom.

speaker: Niles
text: [_pauses_] Well, it's worth that.

speaker: Martin
text: Good, that's the way to look at it.  So let's have a toast to that. [_begins pouring_]

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you, Dad.  You know, I never did sign my lease. I suppose now is as good as time as any. [_picks it up_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, perhaps this will make it easier. [_hands him the Noel Coward pen_] A little housewarming gift.

speaker: Niles
text: [_a little tearful_] Thank you. _Martin comes over and hands Niles and Frasier a drink, he has one for himself._

speaker: Martin
text: Here we go.  Here's looking at you kids! [_they drink_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Niles, you may have to sleep here but you certainly don't have to eat here.  How does Cigare Volante sound?

speaker: Niles
text: [_delighted_] Oh, music to my ears!

speaker: Martin
text: I can't go in that place without a jacket.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know what?  Maybe we should poke through that closet, I bet Gary's got a jacket that'll match those pants. _They go to the closet and finds a checked jacket which Martin tries on and is pleased with.  The three then exit for their favorite restaurant.  End Of Act Two (Time: 21:40)_
